body: i read through the forum issue but cannot guess at the root of problem from the description, yet. how did the .htaccess rules change? how is oc_helper::linktoroute('js_config') related? could you add some more information and logs and edit your initial [post](https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/4337#) with our [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md) in mind? most importantly: the exact steps i need to follow to replicate the problem.

### expected behaviour
site should work?
on apache 2.2 site is fine, same site on apache 2.4 crashes

### actual behaviour
apache/php crashes with "the document contains no data."

i can get the maintenance screen up by setting maintenance=true
and commenting out line 45 in templatelayout.php ... i'll check what that fails 
on later.

i've managed to get a step further forward by disabling search_lucene but i'm 
still working through the load process to find where the rewrites affect things. 
there are a number of changes needed for existing 2.2 sites to work with 2.4, 
including permission settings, but the re-writes are the usual problem :( and 
now the apache list are refusing to help rework the code!

### steps to reproduce
1. upgrade apache to 2.4 ...
2. run clean install
3. installation will create a database, but then crashes

### server configuration
operating system: linux suse12.3

web server: apache 2.4.4

database: sqlite

php version: php 5.4.15

owncloud version: 5.0.9 (now)

### client configuration
browser: seamonkey, firefox, dolphin and konqueror

operating system: linux

### logs
#### web server error log

there is nothing generated in the log !!!

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
there is nothing generated in the log !!!

#### browser log
connection interrupted
the document contains no data.
the network link was interrupted while negotiating a connection. please try again.

back on to this and i'm finding a difference between two setup's ...
on the 'production' backup machine which is used to test prior to upgrading, selecting maintenance mode gives a white screen, but by commenting out the line 45 in templatelayout.php i get a visible page. i've now configured the development system which is a local apache server and eclipse ide and the same fix is not required. the two apache configurations should be clones, but obviously something is different. i still get a white screen for normal access, and i'm just configuring sqlite editor so i can play with the database direct.

( i am a long time interbase/firebird user and at some point firebird will be supported! )
